intro: Sebaea macrostigma, commonly known as the large-stemmed sebaea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, branched stems and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a rough texture. Sebaea macrostigma is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
